intro: Microseris leiosperma, commonly known as the smoothleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are smooth and linear, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Microseris leiosperma is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
